vectorData.altText: 4. The only surface of the liver NOT covered by visceral peritoneum is its  ____________  ____________, where connective tissue binds the liver to the underside of the diaphragm.
That's right! The bare area is in direct contact with the underside of the diaphragm and is bound to it by CT.

On the posterior aspect of the diaphragmatic surface, identify the bare area. This surface was fixed by CT to the inferior surface of the diaphragm, and thus is not covered by visceral peritoneum. Around the bare area, note the cut edges of the coronary ligaments, which form the margins

Note the sharp anterior border of the liver that separates the diaphragmatic surface from the visceral surface. On the visceral surface, note the H-shaped structures and creases that separate the four anatomical lobes of the liver; identify the right lobe, left lobe, caudate lobe and quadrate lobe.
UNCOVER the isolated liver without the diaphragm.
of the bare area. Identify the lateral extensions of the coronary ligaments, which are the right and left triangular ligaments.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
